Posts.Title: Had all treatment & feel terrible!

Posts.Content: She could be pushing you away in case she thinks you'll run away. A self defense measure.  I gave my husband a terrible time of it when I had a insitu malignant melanoma some years ago which compared to now having BC was a walk in the park! We wasn't married then. Having a diagnosis of cancer is a really confusing scary emotional time. Perhaps she doesn't like to be fussed over too much & has found the whole thing just too much. Some patients don't actually like too much fuss & withdraw to think  (thats with a nurses head on). Sometimes people around you end up being looked after more than the patient, perhaps she's trying to protect you. I have found myself jollying my Dad up!! (Which is pretty well bizzare). Even though me and hubby have been together years I had to ask him....................... Well, you know i'll end up with half a boob at least or a masectomy. It will look crap. He said, You will be alive. I said, Shall I put my wig on when we have sex because I will be bald. He said, no dont bother, it should come off if the sex is good enough! I was worrying about my looks, really worrying. It had been on my mind & I hadnt told him. He couldn't of cared less. My one eyebrow came off tonight, I said, What do you think, he said, You never had hardly any eyebrows anyway..... She could be worrying about these things too & many others that seem massive to her. Give her time & don't be a man. Good luck & blessings. x
Posts.Title: confused over relationship

Posts.Content: Thank you all for replying. It's all very kind of you. I had to go to work today for a return to work review and I ended up upsetting the senior manager! I really am not ready for work yet! I think they have realised that now after my little tirade! I phoned the breast care nurse, first time i've done it since I started my treatment & she was very good. I told her how ghastly I was feeling, so she's going to have a word with my oncologist and get me back into clinic for bloods etc as ths morning I nearly passed out/sick. I think what you said, babslomax, my problem is I feel guilty for feeling weak, as i'm used to doing everything. I feel totally incapable and useless. I knew what to expect after chemo, surgery.  The radiologists wasn't that great. They kind of left me a bit in the dark with that one. So now, i'm now sure how i'm expected to feel.
Posts.Title: Had all treatment & feel terrible!

Posts.Content: In my experience, I've found if i'm walking about im ok. My husband has been not too bad but perhaps could be a bit better. Thats just how he is, bloody selfish half the time or doesn't even think!!! A man/Woman thing. Today, I've felt very faigued & had a blinding headache (had a  pyjama day) but he still didnt feed the animals, hasnt washed up or even offered to make me a bloody cup of tea all day!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Do I need to tell him?? I'm not a needy person either, exceptionally independant usually!!! Many women are always used to doing everything & being on top of everything. I'm afraid some men arn't usually. We can multiskill & when we don't they're world falls apart. I'm not being sexist, its just how it is. My dad is useless in the emotional dept, especially after my mom died. My mom was the one who kept on top of the house etc. He does it, but only just. He goes to work so can't do both!! My husband doesn't bloody work and still doesn't do it, so please take heart ladies. Hugs are very important & you've got to tell him so. A cuddle is all you want. This line can become a little blurred for chaps. You've got to make you're voice heard and tell them how you feel. They're certainly not mind readers, I've learn't that for sure.

Posts.Content: A really big big Reiki  hug sue. This is a bloody horrible scary thing, that can go from one extreme to another. I can go from feeling the bravest person in the world & then I get worried but only for a short time. Please don't dwell on the bad stuff, it will do you no good. I don't smoke but I can imagine it must be hard giving up. Especially at a time like this!! Are you trying patches etc to help you & contacting your G.P? I would of thought it's not really right, just to go cold turkey? When you feel exhausted it makes you feel worse too. Call the breast care nurses, they are good. It takes a while to recover from surgery. The aneasthetic takes ages to get out your system. Give yourself time to recover & relax. It's a tough journey this is. Sending love & hugs, Sharon.
